title: invalid
body:
On master branch and RoR 4.1.19, I have the following Order:

``` ruby
ActiveAdmin.register Order do
  filter :payment_type
  # irrelevant code redacted ...  
end
```

The Order model: 

``` ruby
# +-----------------------------------------+---------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+
# | Field                                   | Type          | Null | Key | Default | Extra          |
# +-----------------------------------------+---------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+
# | id                                      | int(11)       | NO   | PRI | NULL    | auto_increment |
# | payment_type_code                       | varchar(31)   | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
# +-----------------------------------------+---------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+
class Order < ActiveRecord::Base
  belongs_to  :payment_type,      
      :class_name => "PaymentType",   
      :foreign_key => "payment_type_code"
  # irrelevant code redacted ...  
end
```

When visiting the Orders page, the following error is raised:

```
undefined method `payment_type_code_eq_eq_eq_eq_eq' for Ransack::Search<class: Order, base: Grouping <combinator: and>>:Ransack::Search
```

If visited a subsequent time, the "_eq" is appended even more!

```
undefined method `payment_type_code_eq_eq_eq_eq_eq_eq_eq_eq_eq_eq' for Ransack::Search<class: Order, base: Grouping <combinator: and>>:Ransack::Search
```

The following monkey patch resolves:

``` ruby
module ActiveAdmin
  module Inputs
    module Filters
      class SelectInput < ::Formtastic::Inputs::SelectInput
        def input_name
          return method if seems_searchable?
          if searchable_method_name.ends_with?("_eq") || searchable_method_name.ends_with?("_in")
            return searchable_method_name 
          end
          searchable_method_name.concat multiple? ? '_in' : '_eq'
        end
      end
    end
  end
end
```

This patch basically preempts adding "_in" or "_eq" if it already exists on the name.
